title: Print on Celebration of 15th Amendment - purpose

content.description:
The Result of the Fifteenth Amendment

The center of the lithograph depicts a large, celebratory parade of African Americans marching through the street away from Baltimore’s Washington Monument while a crowd watches.

The center image is surrounded by 11 smaller vignettes showing busts of various antislavery figures and scenes depicting changes in African American life.

Some notable figures include Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant, John Brown, and Frederick Douglass.

Scenes include African Americans working as enslaved people, African Americans fighting during the Civil War, and African American children attending school.

Text at the bottom of the lithograph reads “The Result of the Fifteenth Amendment, And the Rise and Progress of the African Race in America and its final Accomplishment, and Celebration on May 19th A.D. 1870.”
Library of Congress
A print marking the enactment of the Fifteenth Amendment, and showing the parade celebrating it which was held in Baltimore on May 19, 1870.
content.question: Which of the following was a likely purpose of the image?

choices.label: To highlight the need for African American schools in the North
To promote the agricultural accomplishments of African Americans in the South
To advocate for the enlistment of African American soldiers in the Union Army
To celebrate the progress gained by African Americans during Reconstruction

content.answer: To celebrate the progress gained by African Americans during Reconstruction
